result.execSummary:
The defendant Deonta L Benton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Murder-Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $2,000.00 to the Crime Victim Compensation Fund and $500.00 to Hazel W.  To be paid joint and several with codefendant Jerron Washington 13CF004002  and Tynell McCoy 13CF4998.

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay applicable costs, surcharges, victim witness surcharge and assessments.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid through colection by DOC from 25% of fundsunder SEc. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Restitution to be paid first.

DEFENDANT TO BE KEPT SEPARATE FROM TYNELL McCOY AND JERRON WASHINGTION WHILE IN CUSTODY.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence/matter.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek/maintain full time employment.  Obtain GED/HSED.
Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medication.

No further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with the victim or the victims family or codefendants.

Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
Pay all supervision fees.
AODA asssessment.  Comply with any treatment. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession; voting.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence/matter and count one.

records.addlTxt: per order dated September 23, 2016, Appeal 2016AP694CR, the clerk of circuit court shall transmit the above-described transcript to the clerk of this court by supplemental return. The deadline for transmittal shall be ten days from the date of this order, or ten days from the date that Reporter Pierce files the replacement transcript in circuit court, whichever is later. Benton shall file and serve his appellant's brief and appendix within eleven days after the supplemental return is filed in the court of appeals and further briefing shall proceed in accordance with the rules of appellate procedure.

No appearances.  Case called to address Material Witness Montrell M.  who is still in custody.  Court ordered the witness be released from custody forthwith with not further conditions.
Jury questions - sealed.

Defendant Deonta L Benton in court with attorney Richard E Poulson.  Defendant Deonta L Benton in custody.  Mark S Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
At the hour of 12:25 p.m.  the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2 which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Exhibit list received and filed.  Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  Court ordered a PSI without a recommendation.  Order for PSI signed and filed.  Case adjourned to Br 12.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-29-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deonta L Benton in court with attorney Richard Poulson.  Defendant Deonta L Benton in custody.  Mark S Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Timothy Graham-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12 due to co-defendant's lower pending case.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deonta L Benton in court with attorney Gregory Renden.  Defendant Deonta L Benton in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
